result.execSummary:
The defendant John O.H. Nelsen II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John O.H. Nelsen II

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from the DE to the Court

Case called @ 11:05 a.m. Defendant John O.H. Nelsen in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have had a PTC and a resolution had been reached. After further contemplation the defendant wishes to have counsel but is unable to afford one. Defendant does not qualify for SPD services. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Count 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 2 days CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

14TR1980: Plea - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court orders: $800 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP, $42.50 blood draw costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 8 mos DL revocation, OWI Assessment. No IID restriction ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on January 29, 2015 at 01:05 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 14CF-165 and 14TR-1980 - Both Cases Called @ 2:58 PM: Defendant John O.H. Nelsen in court, appears w/o Atty Haase due to withdrawal.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he does not qualify for SPD services and cannot afford fees to hire his own.  He will proceed today w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of right to counsel to allow for discussions with the State.  Court undertakes waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:05 pm.
Petition and Order to Withdraw as Counsel

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on December 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance on November 6, 2014 at 10:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:05 p.m. Defendant John O.H. Nelsen in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not wish to have counsel at this time. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by DE. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 10:45 am.
